meanings.definition: To sell or promote something in an aggressive or dishonest way.
meanings.sent1: The salesman huckstered the fake medicine to unsuspecting customers.
meanings.sent2: She huckstered her products by making false claims about their benefits.
meanings.sent3: The street performer huckstered his magic tricks to draw a crowd.
meanings.sent4: The politician huckstered his promises to win votes.
meanings.sent5: The con artist huckstered his way into people's trust.

meanings.definition: A person who sells goods or services in an aggressive or dishonest way.
meanings.sent1: The huckstered tried to deceive customers with his fake products.
meanings.sent2: She knew he was a huckstered when he made unbelievable claims about his services.
meanings.sent3: The town had a reputation for huckstereds selling low-quality goods.
meanings.sent4: The market was full of huckstereds trying to make a quick profit.
meanings.sent5: The huckstered's tactics were exposed by an investigative journalist.
